creditline: Gift of Elizabeth, Julie, and Catherine Andrus in memory of John and Marion Andrus
description: pony at L with monkey on its back, holding a branch that a dog is pulling on; another monkey on a bent tree trunk at R holding a club above dog's head; bee in ULQ, small shrubs on ground
marks:
Signature, Inscription

numbered in plate at bot monogram in plate, upper right: [NB]
provenance: [C. & J. Goodfriend, New York, until November 11, 1986; sold to Andrus]; John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn.; by descent to his daughters, Elizabeth, Katie, and Julie. Earlier provenances have been gathered, but further research will increase our knowledge of their histories.
title: Horse with Two Monkeys and a Dog, From Fighting Chimeras and Scenes to Aesop's Fables, Plate 9
